Lebanese patriarch, in Saudi, says supports reasons Hariri quit

<p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/lebanese-patriarch-saudi-says-supports-reasons-hariri-quit-142312712.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/nZvkYQQ2w7iA_rEilyC2zA--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2017-11-14T142312Z_1_LYNXMPEDAD14I_RTROPTP_2_SAUDI-LEBANON-PATRIARCH.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Lebanese patriarch, in Saudi, says supports reasons Hariri quit" align="left" title="Lebanese patriarch, in Saudi, says supports reasons Hariri quit" border="0" ></a>By Stephen Kalin RIYADH (Reuters) - Lebanon's Christian Maronite Patriarch, visiting Saudi Arabia in an historic visit to the ultra-conservative Muslim kingdom, expressed support on Tuesday for the reasons behind Lebanese Prime Minister Saad al-Hariri's resignation. Hariri, a Saudi ally, resigned abruptly on Nov. 4 in a move Lebanese political leaders ascribed to pressure from Riyadh. Hariri said his resignation had been prompted by an assassination plot and accused Iran and Hezbollah of sowing strife in the region.<p><br clear="all">

Gay senator Penny Wong cries tears of joy as Australia backs same-sex marriage

<p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/gay-senator-penny-wong-cries-154842587.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/wXGG6M2kjxbmL7gihO_e2g--/YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b247aD04Njt3PTEzMDs-/http://media.zenfs.com/en-GB/homerun/the_telegraph_258/c484a3eb49467412e1f3e003b548ccb5" width="130" height="86" alt="Gay senator Penny Wong cries tears of joy as Australia backs same-sex marriage " align="left" title="Gay senator Penny Wong cries tears of joy as Australia backs same-sex marriage " border="0" ></a>Australian senator Penny Wong’s tears of joy in front of TV cameras perfectly captured the country’s emotive response to the vote backing same-sex marriage. Wong, the country’s first openly gay female politician, was hugged by colleagues as the winning margin of 62 per cent to 38 per cent was declared. Penny Wong cries tears of joy after Australia&apos;s same-sex marriage result Credit: YouTube “To all Australians thank you for standing up for fairness and equality,” she later tweeted. “To my colleagues and all those who fought for this great outcome, thank you.” She later told reporters: “Thank you Australia. Thank you for standing up for the sort of Australia we believe in. An Australia that is decent, that is fair, is accepting and an Australia that turns its back on exclusion and division. “Now Australians have done their part, it is time for the parliament to do our part and together we will.” To all Australians thank you for standing up for fairness and equality. To my colleagues and all those who fought for this great outcome, thank you. pic.twitter.com/g8gaQJtzyC— Senator Penny Wong (@SenatorWong) November 15, 2017 She said that it is “time to change the marriage law”, adding: “It is time to remove discrimination, it is time for equality. “I hope that everyone in this parliament has heard the resounding voice of the Australian people today, a mandate for change, a mandate for fairness, a mandate for equality, because it is time. Members of the gay community and their supporters celebrate the result Credit: AP “To the LGBTI community across Australia, you didn’t want this process and it has been really hard for many of you. I hope from this you can take a message of solidarity, of support and of decency from your fellow Australians.” As the result of the postal vote is non-binding, a marriage equality bill is now set to be considered in parliament before Christmas. Man proposes moments after learning Australia votes yes to same-sex marriage on live TV<p><br clear="all">
